definition: to grieve over sb's death/to lament sb's death/mourning
Ai (c. 2000 BC), sixth of legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Li 釐|厘[Li2]
sorrow/grief/pity/to grieve for/to pity/to lament/to condole

sentences.english: But the onset of dementia invites no ceremony, no grieving.
sentences.chinese: 癡呆症的發作沒有預兆，也沒有哀悼。

sentences.english: He expressed condolence for his loved dog.
sentences.chinese: 他爲愛狗的去世表示哀悼。

sentences.english: UN Secretary-General Ban Ki- moon has also extended his condolences.
sentences.chinese: 聯合國祕書長潘基文也對巴西火災遇難者表示哀悼。

sentences.english: For me it is a day of mourning and grief.
sentences.chinese: 對我來說，這一天就是哀悼和痛苦的一天。

sentences.english: I mourned quietly inside my room.
sentences.chinese: 我在我的房間中默默哀悼。

sentences.english: I would like to express my condolences to Agricultural Minister Matsuoka's family and wife he has left behind.
sentences.chinese: 我想對農林水產大臣的家人和妻子表達我的哀悼之情。

sentences.english: We grieve for him at this very sad time.
sentences.chinese: 在這非常悲傷的時刻我們向他表示哀悼。

sentences.english: Fellow entertainers including Chow Yun-Fat, the couple's long-time friend, have sent condolences.
sentences.chinese: 娛樂圈內演藝人員包括摯友周潤發前至哀悼慰問。

sentences.english: The mourners around me give me sideways glances or just stare.
sentences.chinese: 我周圍的哀悼者斜着瞥我一眼或者乾脆直盯着我看。

sentences.english: The decision to initiate a national period of mourning marked the first time in memory that China has done so.
sentences.chinese: 實施全國哀悼日的決定在中國歷史上尚無先例。

sentences.english: People wore crapes to mourn him.
sentences.chinese: 人們配帶黑紗以哀悼他。

sentences.english: Many have mourned the snuffing out of the three young lives.
sentences.chinese: 許多人爲三個年輕的生命哀悼。

sentences.english: White means mourning in China and Japan.
sentences.chinese: 在中國和日本，白色表示哀悼。

sentences.english: A memorial service is planned at Pomona College.
sentences.chinese: 坡摩那學院正在籌備一場紀念哀悼會。

sentences.english: At the center, pet owners mourn together.
sentences.chinese: 而在中心，寵物主人在一起哀悼。

sentences.english: I condoled with him on the death of his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他妻子死了，我向他表示哀悼。

definition: to mourn/to pay last respects/mourning/memorial (service etc)
to commemorate/to recall fondly/to think of the past
to observe a moment of silence in tribute
to pay respects to the dead/to mark sb's passing
to offer sacrifices (to one's ancestors)/to hold or attend a memorial service
